video.title: Hollywood's Best Film Directors
video.synopsis: In revealing interviews, top Hollywood directors share their own backstories and divulge the nitty-gritty details of crafting memorable films.

episodes.synopsis:
Learn how this immigrant from Czechoslovakia became a king of the comedy genre with films like 
"Ghostbusters" and "Kindergarten Cop."
episodes.title: Ivan Reitman

episodes.synopsis: Francis Ford Coppola speaks frankly about his illustrious career and shares stories about working with Marlon Brando on "The Godfather."
episodes.title: Francis Ford Coppola

episodes.synopsis: Oscar winner Barry Levinson discusses his work on the iconic films "Rain Man," "Wag the Dog," "Good Morning, Vietnam" and more.
episodes.title: Barry Levinson

episodes.synopsis: Rob Reiner shares funny anecdotes from classics like "Stand by Me" and "When Harry Met Sally," and dishes on "A Few Good Men" star Jack Nicholson.
episodes.title: Rob Reiner

episodes.synopsis: George Lucas welcomes viewers to his office in San Francisco and speaks openly about his career, including his work on the "Star Wars" saga.
episodes.title: George Lucas

episodes.synopsis: Brett Ratner reveals how he convinced Anthony Hopkins to do "Red Dragon" and how Jackie Chan and Chris Tucker ended up starring in "Rush Hour."
episodes.title: Brett Ratner

episodes.synopsis: The talented John McTiernan tells all about his collaborations with Bruce Willis, Sean Connery and Arnold Schwarzenegger.
episodes.title: John McTiernan

episodes.synopsis: Director Michael Mann talks about pairing up Al Pacino and Robert De Niro in "Heat" and collaborating with Will Smith on "Ali."
episodes.title: Michael Mann

episodes.synopsis: "The Usual Suspects" director Bryan Singer discusses his collaboration with Tom Cruise on "Valkyrie" and reveals details about "Superman Returns."
episodes.title: Bryan Singer

episodes.synopsis: The Oscar-winning director of "Amadeus," "One Flew over the Cuckoo's Nest" and "The People vs. Larry Flynt" welcomes viewers into his New York home.
episodes.title: Milos Forman

episodes.synopsis: John Singleton welcomes viewers to his L.A. offices and reflects on his film career, which includes "Boyz n the Hood," "2 Fast 2 Furious" and "Shaft."
episodes.title: John Singleton

episodes.synopsis: Meet the humble director behind some of the most successful films in history, including "Apollo 13," "The Da Vinci Code" and "A Beautiful Mind."
episodes.title: Ron Howard

episodes.synopsis: Oscar-winning director and producer James L. Brooks recounts some of the funniest moments from his long and illustrious career.
episodes.title: James L. Brooks

episodes.synopsis: Paul Greengrass shares fascinating stories from his throughout his career, including his collaboration with Matt Damon on "The Bourne Ultimatum."
episodes.title: Paul Greengrass

episodes.synopsis: Director Martin Campbell discusses career highlights, including "The Mask of Zorro" with Antonio Banderas and "Casino Royale" with Daniel Craig.
episodes.title: Martin Campbell

episodes.synopsis: Prolific director Ridley Scott discusses his work on "Gladiator," "Blade Runner," "Alien," "Thelma & Louise" and other groundbreaking films.
episodes.title: Ridley Scott

episodes.synopsis: Mel Gibson shares stories from his acting days and his work as the director of "Braveheart," "The Passion of the Christ" and "Apocalypto."
episodes.title: Mel Gibson

episodes.synopsis: Jon Favreau reveals how he made the transition from stockbroker to one of Hollywood's top directors and shares anecdotes about "Elf" and "Iron Man."
episodes.title: Jon Favreau

episodes.synopsis: Learn how a bored young man from a remote French village built a movie empire from scratch. The director reflects on "Leon," "Lucy" and other hits.
episodes.title: Luc Besson

episodes.synopsis: Bobby and Peter Farrelly reveal how they stumbled into a megahit with "Dumb and Dumber" and talk about casting funnyman Jim Carrey.
episodes.title: Farrelly Brothers
